questions.text: As per usual, the surgeons at the 4077th are working on a batch of new wounded in the O.R.  Is it true that Frank works on a young Korean boy who 'can't be 5-years old'?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Hawkeye is on the case, assisted by Trapper.  Later, after inquiring about the young boy, they find that there is no sign of the child's family.

questions.text: Trapper especially seems to be enjoying the young Korean boy.  He makes reference to his own children in this episode.  Which of these correctly describes Trapper's offspring?
questions.explanation:
Two daughters.

	Trapper has two beautiful daughters, and he is obviously homesick for them.  Their names are Kathy and Becky.

questions.text: In the post-op ward, the cute little child is surrounded by doctors and nurses who shower him with attention and gifts.  What strange food items does Trapper bring for the lad?
questions.explanation:
Anchovy paste and pickled onions.

	Hawkeye reads 'smut' to the boy, who can't understand a word.  While in the process of reading, Trapper brings in his odd culinary gifts.  All of this is too much for Frank and Margaret who insist on a little military decorum.  Everyone is dismissed from the O.R. after Henry walks in on the ruckus.

questions.text: Becoming more and more attached to the child, Trapper fashions a small toy for the boy.  What does he fashion this toy with?
questions.explanation:
A latex glove.

	Trapper blows up a latex glove and paints a face on it.  He makes the comment, 'He may be the cutest kid I've ever seen in my life.'  It's becoming clear that Trapper is preparing to do something drastic, like adopt the little pipsqueak.

questions.text: Since no one knows the origin of this young boy, Henry has made a command decision.  He will turn the young toddler over to a local orphanage.  What is the name of the nun who runs the orphanage?
questions.explanation:
Sister Theresa.

	Sister Theresa's name comes up a lot in later 'M*A*S*H' episodes, especially as she is associated with this orphanage that Father Mulcahy so passionately supports.  Maggie Roswell plays Sister Theresa in this episode.

questions.text: Before the boy is shipped off to the orphanage, the dwellers of the 4077th get a chance to bond with him a bit more.  For example, we see him in a scene in Margaret's tent where she reads what classic children's story to him?
questions.explanation:
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.

	The boy is seen playing catch with Klinger and sleeping in Radar's bed (with Radar taking his teddy bear from the clutches of the sleeping tot) before we see him in Hot Lip's tent.  There, she reads to him until Frank comes in wondering when the two of them will have their next 'discussion'.

questions.text: Trapper can't stand the idea of this tiny boy being shipped over to an orphanage, and decides he will adopt his new little friend.  Trapper writes his wife to get permission.  What is Trapper's wife's name?
questions.explanation:
Louise.

	Trapper is not the only 'M*A*S*H' character who has a wife named Louise, that's the name of Frank's wife as well!  Happily, Louise gives her full support to Trapper vis-a-vis adopting the boy, and the process is all set to move forward.  But...

questions.text: Just when things seemed to be blissful at the 4077th, trouble rears its ugly head.  The little boy has walked straight into a minefield!  With his life at risk, what Korean word do several of the characters scream to the boy, telling him to 'stop'?
questions.explanation:
Kutchio.

	Kutchio means 'stop', according to Margaret, who also adds the word 'nuguo', which she says means 'stay'.  Trapper and Frank also shout 'kutchio' to the boy who seems blissfully unaware of the danger he is in.

questions.text: Trapper bravely makes his way through the minefield in order to save the boy.  Meanwhile, Henry directs Trapper from a safe distance.  Ultimately, we find out that Henry is using the wrong map when he claims that Trapper is now safely in downtown where?
questions.explanation:
Berlin.

	Unbelieveably, Henry is using a World War II surplus map to guide Trapper through the minefield.  When it's discovered that Trapper is surrounded on all sides by mines, Hawkeye insists he wait until the chopper arrives.

questions.correct: He is returned to his mother
options: He tragically dies of injuries sustained in the minefield
He is sent to the orphanage
He is adopted by Trapper and sent to Boston
questions.explanation:
He is returned to his mother.

	Just after being saved by Trapper, a truck pulls up, driven by Sister Theresa.  She has located the boy's mother, and she calls out to him.  Kim is his name.  A very disappointed Trapper comments, 'Who needs a kid who wonders into minefields?'  Poor Trapper.
